availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David W. McGoodwin (Caldwell County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, attorney. Logan County, Kentucky native. Married to Susan C. B. D. Wigginton McGoodwin in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on March 31, 1827. Father of John D. McGoodwin, James P. McGoodwin, Albert M. McGoodwin, Charles A. McGoodwin, Edwin P. McGoodwin, Henry Clay McGoodwin, and Mary E. McGoodwin. Resident in Caldwell County in 1840. Owned four enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1840. Attorney in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Attorney in Princeton in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 116.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 218B.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 90.
